redirect.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to use something for a different purpose
redirect.translation[0].definitions[0].e: She was good at redirecting the children’s energy into something useful.
redirect.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to send something in a different direction
redirect.translation[0].definitions[1].e: The flight was redirected to Cleveland.
redirect.translation[0].definitions[2].d: to send someone’s letters to their new address from an address that they have left
redirect.translation[1].definitions[0].d: to use money, effort etc for a different purpose
redirect.translation[1].definitions[0].e: We are redirecting funds to other departments.
Management effort needs to be redirected into strategy and decision-making.
redirect.translation[1].definitions[1].d: to send someone’s letters to their new address from an address that they have left
redirect.translation[1].definitions[1].e: All mail will be redirected to our new offices.
